column1: The selo of Alexandrovskoye (Алекса́ндровское) was founded in 1860 by the settlers from the European part of Russia. In 1893
column2: the selo of Bochkaryovka (Бочкарёвка) appeared nearby. The two localities grew with the construction of a station on the Trans-Siberian Railway in 1913
column3: and by 1923 Alexandrovskoye and Bochkarevka merged and were transformed into Alexandrovsk (Алекса́ндровск). Town status was granted to Alexandrovsk in 1926. In 1931

column1: Belogorsk saw a record high temperature for Asian Russia at 42.3 °C (108.1 °F) on 25 June 2010. This record was beaten two days later in Ust-Karsk.

column2: Belogorsk serves as the administrative center of Belogorsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column5: together with one rural locality (the selo of Nizinnoye)
column6: incorporated separately as Belogorsk Urban Okrug—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: this administrative unit also has urban okrug status.

The town is home to important military elements of the Eastern Military District
column2: specifically the headquarters of the 35th Army and the 21st Guards Motor Rifle Division. Nearby is the Ukrainka air base
column3: home to elements of Long Range Aviation.
